Ad Text:
Mid Level - Azure Cloud Engineer
Location: Melbourne (Hybrid WFH)
Salary: A$137k base + super + 10% bonus
Start Date: Ideally January 2026 (flexible)

Are you an experienced Azure Cloud Engineer looking for a role that balances governance, hands-on cloud work, and career growth? Join a vibrant technology team where inclusivity, collaboration, mentorship, and innovation are at the heart of everything we do.

Why You’ll Love This Role
Hybrid Flexibility: CBD office, plus work from home 2-3 days per week, flexible with start and finish times in the office
Impactful Work: 50% governance, 50% hands-on – shape cloud strategy while staying technical.
Career Progression: Grow into automation, security, and AI-focused areas.
Collaborative Culture: Join a small, highly skilled team where your voice matters and your expertise drives decisions.
Learning Opportunities: Exposure to AI-driven automation and modern infrastructure practices.
Your Role 

Designing Azure governance frameworks: policies, naming conventions, tagging strategies, cost management, compliance monitoring
Defining and enforcing Azure Policy and management group hierarchies
Building self-service provisioning solutions with Azure Automation, Logic Apps, and OpenAI tools
Developing infrastructure-as-code using PowerShell, Bicep (preferred) and Terraform
Building and managing CI/CD pipelines with Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions
Collaborating with architecture, DevOps, and security teams to align with Microsoft’s Well-Architected Framework
Supporting BAU Azure operations: monitoring, patching, and environment lifecycle management
Applying systems administration knowledge across Windows, Linux, and Active Directory
Mentoring junior engineers and participating in architecture reviews
Continuously improving internal processes and automation templates
What We’re Looking For
3–4 years of hands-on Azure experience, particularly governance, policy, and management groups
Strong skills in Infrastructure-as-Code: Bicep preferred, Terraform familiar
Knowledge of tagging strategies and monitoring solutions
Systems engineering background: Windows, Linux, Active Directory
Collaborative, mature, and open to developing AI-driven automation skills
Motivated to learn, innovate, and contribute in a small, supportive team
Why This Could Be Perfect for You
We’re looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative, supportive, and inclusive environment. This role is ideal for engineers who enjoy both governance frameworks and hands-on Azure work, with opportunities to grow into automation, security, and AI-driven cloud solutions. 

Apply Now!
